sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not distributive over complement.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B, i.e., (A △ B). Then find the complement of each set and find the symmetric difference of their complements, i.e., [(Ac △ Bc)]. Show that (A △ B) and [(Ac △ Bc)] are not equal, thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not distributive over complement.
